content: sherri crochets & crafts proudly presents huggable georgie pattern designed by sherri bush copyright summer 2008 this pattern may not be distributed or sold by anyone other than myself you may make and construct this pattern and sell what you make from this pattern but you may not sell or give away the pattern itself page 1 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com georgie pattern pattern difficulty medium i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together supplies size g hook worsted weight yarn red heart super saver works nicely  black  white  skin tone  navy blue  brown  12 - 14 mm safety eyes optional you can embroider the eyes or make them from felt if you prefer  polyfil gauge is unimportant for this project terms  skort = a pair of shorts with a skirt attached  single_crochet = single_crochet  increase = increase two single_crochet in same stitch  decrease = single_crochet two stitches together or decrease crochet two stitches together  chain 1 t = chain 1 turn  leave at least an 8 tail when you bind off each piece you can then use that tail to sew the piece to the little person later on  weave in starting tails as you go note this pattern is worked in the round when i crochet i join rounds and i single_crochet in the same space as joining so i m assuming that at the end of each round you are slip stitching to the first stitch of that round and that you chain 1 to start the next round you can work in spirals if that s easier for you just remember to mark your rounds you want your stitches tight and close together so the stuffing doesn t show through later on to start each piece you can chain 2 and work your 6 stitches into the 2nd stitch from the hook or you can use the magic adjustable be creative and have fun page 2 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com the hair these are the instructions to make the hair curly if you want curly hair do this part first before you make any other parts if you don t want curly hair you can skip this part and just cut 6 inch lengths of yarn later on to make the hair straight 1 you need to crochet or knit a swatch of your hair colored yarn approximately 50 stitches wide and 13 row high i used an h hook my doll has 5 or 6 row of hair make your swatch bigger if you want more hair single_crochet will make tighter curls than double_crochet knitting makes a nice curled yarn too 2 when finished with step one wet the square thoroughly wrap it in a towel and squeeze
